alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:26PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clackamas, northeastern Yamhill, northwestern Marion, southwestern Multnomah and southeastern Washington Counties through 400 PM PST... At 325 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Butteville, or 14 miles southwest of Oregon City, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Portland, Beaverton, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, Newberg, Wilsonville, Aurora, Garden Home-Whitford, West Haven-Sylvan, Metzger, Oak Hills, St. Johns, Cedar Mill, West Slope, Woodburn and Sherwood. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 270 and 293. Interstate 205 near mile marker 1. U.S. Highway 26 west of Portland between mile markers 59 and 71. U.S. Highway 30 west of Portland between mile markers 5 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area
